de.feig.FEDM.Core.TagHandler

Class TH_ISO15693

  • java.lang.Object
    • de.feig.FEDM.Core.TagHandler.TH_Base
      • de.feig.FEDM.Core.TagHandler.TH_ISO15693
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    TH_ISO15693_EM, TH_ISO15693_Fujitsu, TH_ISO15693_IDS_SL13A, TH_ISO15693_Infineon, TH_ISO15693_KSW, TH_ISO15693_Maxim, TH_ISO15693_NXP, TH_ISO15693_STM, TH_ISO15693_TI

    public class TH_ISO15693
extends TH_Base
    Class for ISO15693 compliant transponder.
    This class supports addressed, non-addressed and selected mode in Host-Mode
    .
    Description:
    High-level class for easy-to-use Transponder specific communication. See ITagGroup for additional information.
    This class supports non-addressed, selected and addressed mode in Host-Mode

    Note: Programmers should be familiar with the ISO 15693 standard.

        public java.lang.String getManufacturerName()
        Returns name of Chip Manufacturer
        Returns:
        String with name of Chip Manufacturer
        Description:
        Method returns name of Chip Manufacturer, which is coded in the 2nd byte of the UID.

      • stayQuiet

        public int stayQuiet()
              throws FeException
        Stay Quiet command
        Returns:
        operation status
        • 0 if OK
        • > 0 status byte of the responded protocol, if the Reader signals a problem. See Reader's System Manual for the full list with all status bytes
        Throws:
        FeException - exception with error code (<0)
        Description:
        [0xB0][0x02] Stay Quiet command
        See Reader's System Manual for detailed information about the command

      • getSystemInformation

        public int getSystemInformation(TH_ISO15693_TagInfoResult result)
                         throws FeException
        Read of system information from a transponder
        Parameters:
        result - TH_ISO15693_TagInfoResult object containing return values
        Returns:
        operation status
        • 0 if OK
        • > 0 status byte of the responded protocol, if the Reader signals a problem. See Reader's System Manual for the full list with all status bytes
        Throws:
        FeException - exception with error code (<0)
        Description:
        Basic [0xB0][0x23] Read Multiple Blocks command
        - Without support for extended address mode
        - Without request of security status
        The result object of type TH_ISO15693_TagInfoResult contains only valid data, if the operation status is 0.

        See Reader's System Manual for detailed information about the command

      • getMultipleBlockSecurityStatus

        public int getMultipleBlockSecurityStatus(int firstDataBlock,
                                          int noOfDataBlocks,
                                          TH_Result result)
                                   throws FeException
        Read of security status from transponder data
        Parameters:
        firstDataBlock - first data block address
        noOfDataBlocks - number of requested data blocks
        result - TH_Result object containing return values
        Returns:
        operation status
        • 0 if OK
        • > 0 status byte of the responded protocol, if the Reader signals a problem. See Reader's System Manual for the full list with all status bytes
        Throws:
        FeException - exception with error code (<0)
        Description:
        Basic [0xB0][0x23] Read Multiple Blocks command with additional security status
        - Without support for extended address mode
        The result object of type TH_Result contains only valid data (result.securityStatus), if the operation status is 0.

        See Reader's System Manual for detailed information about the command

      • authenticate

        public int authenticate(byte authentMethode,
                        byte csi,
                        byte cryptoTime,
                        int rspLen,
                        byte[] message,
                        TH_Result result)
                 throws FeException
        Autenticate a ISO15693 Transponder
        Parameters:
        authentMethode - which methode of authent
        csi - number of cryptosuite
        message - cryptomessage to the transponder, depends on csi
        result - TH_Result object containing return values
        Returns:
        operation status
        • 0 if OK
        • > 0 status byte of the responded protocol, if the Reader signals a problem. See Reader's System Manual for the full list with all status bytes
        Throws:
        FeException - exception with error code (<0)
        Description:
        Basic [0xB0][0x35] Authenticate command
        The result object of type TH_Result contains only valid data (result.data), if the operation status is 0.

        See Reader's System Manual and transponder datasheet for detailed information about the command

      • transparentCommand

        public int transparentCommand(byte mode,
                              int rspBitLen,
                              int cmdRspDelay,
                              int eofPulseDelay,
                              int multiGrids,
                              byte[] request,
                              TH_Result result)
                       throws FeException
        [0xBF] Transparent Command
        Parameters:
        mode - Mode (Bit0..3 = Options, Bit7 = TxCRCEnab)
        rspBitLen - Length of the transponder response in bits without SOF and EOF
        cmdRspDelay - Command response delay
        eofPulseDelay - EOF pulse delay (only for options 3,4)
        multiGrids - Multiple 302Âµs grids (only for option 5)
        request - Request data
        result - Response data
        Returns:
        operation status
        • 0 if OK
        • > 0 status byte of the responded protocol, if the Reader signals a problem. See Reader's System Manual for the full list with all status bytes
        Throws:
        FeException - exception with error code (<0)
        Description:
        General implementation of the [0xBF] transparent command
        This command is a low-level command which can be used only with deep knowledge about the RF communication between the Reader and the used Transponder chip.
        The result object of type TH_Result contains only valid data (result.data), if the operation status is 0.

        See Reader's System Manual and transponder datasheet for detailed information about the command
